results.title: Liquid Sun (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Apace Research and Sydney University Television Services
results.brief_description: The production of power alcohol from farm crops, and its uses as motor fuel is causing great interest in Australia. It is a major challenge facing primary producers and could be an economic proposition in many areas

results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.

results.title: C.E.P. What's that Got to Do with Being Here?
results.brief_description: The C.E.P. (Country Education Project) is an innovative body designed to tackle the industrial needs of rural communities. The projects are either school or community based, depending on individual educational requirements, and have a full-time regional co-ordinator. Outlines the C.E.P. philosophy and takes a close look at programs currently operating in the Ovens and King Valley regions of Victoria.

results.title: The Cubbies
results.creator_credit: David Woodgate, Ron Saunders and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Features an adventure playground which allows children to play on their own terms, and enables creative expression. Through the eyes of Joan Healy, Supervisor of the Fitzroy Adventure Playground (South Australia), the film takes a candid look at the children and their projects.

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division and Panorama Productions
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language

results.title: Tucker
results.brief_description: Highlights the importance of good food habits. The importance of early experiences is emphasized, together with the valuable role of the school canteen and the teachers who promote good eating habits using the basic five food groups.

results.title: Futures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Work that was”.
One of a 3 part series on unemployment in Australia, presented by Keith Windschuttle. Looks at the decline of labour intensive manufacturing industries in Australia, and considers whether the coming mineral boom will lead to lower unemployment rates. Also looks at some of the effects that technological change has had on employment, and at a number of local community efforts to decrease unemployment in country towns. Presented by Keith Windschuttle.

results.title: Down River
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gippsland”.
For some, floods are a disaster, for others a necessary lifegiving event. The quite different ecology of the riverland is explored in this Gippsland Victoria series, which gives an insight into the Gippsland region and the full scope of natural phenomenon
